title: Licensing Question
content:
Hi all.   
   
I've been paying alot more attention to licensing agreements since browsing this site! Seems like almost all licences are based on the number of computers. What about corporate ID? Say I'm using Bauer Bodoni in a logo and as a client
author: anonymous

comments.content:
\> I've been paying alot more attention to licensing agreements since browsing this site!   
   
"Typophile: Increasing awareness, one font-freak at a time."   
   
Generally, you can use a font in a logo (even without much alteration) and you have to pay nothing extra. If you want many employees to \*use\* the font, you buy something called a "site license".
